intro: Stefanoffia daucoides, commonly known as the slender carrot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of carrots, giving it its common name. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and fragrance.
